article.title: Prediction of Kidney Function from Biopsy Images Using Convolutional Neural Networks

multiple_choice_question.text: What part of the kidney is responsible for separating the watery filtrate from the blood?

choices: A microscopic view of healthy lung tissue
A processed image of a kidney biopsy
A cross-section of a human heart
A digital scan of a brain tumor

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of the process illustrated in Figure 3?
choices: Identifying different types of cells within the kidney tissue
Isolating and rotating kidney sections for analysis
Measuring the size and shape of individual glomeruli
Enhancing the image quality to improve visual clarity

multiple_choice_question.text: What does this formula describe? **Formula: W = U (-√6/(nin + nout), √6/(nin + nout))**
choices: The calculation of estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
The process of downsampling images to a manageable resolution
The weight initialization method used in the convolutional neural network
The mathematical relationship between kidney function and biopsy features
